message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the performance limits of short polar codes and proposes a decoding algorithm to approach the finite blocklength capacity. This topic is closely related to information theory (cs.IT) and communication theory (cs.COMM). The proposed algorithm involves decoding the received sequence in two steps, which can be seen as a form of distributed systems (cs.DS) or system engineering (cs.SY). The use of CRC codes is also relevant to network protocols (cs.NI).
